channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Student-loan borrowers should be prepared for major changes coming in 2026
Here’s how to make your New Year’s financial resolutions actually happen
Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK and cousin of Health Secretary RFK Jr., dies of cancer at 35
item.description: Her death comes just weeks after she publicly revealed in The New Yorker that she had been diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia.

item.title: ‘Our beautiful Tatiana passed away this morning. She will always be in our hearts’: Kennedy family mourns yet another tragic death
item.description: Schlossberg had worked as a reporter covering climate change and the environment for The New York Times’ Science section.

item.title: Buddhist monks peace-walking from Texas to DC persist even after being run over on highway outside Houston
item.description: One of the monks had “substantial leg injuries” and was flown by helicopter to a hospital in Houston, Dayton Interim Police Chief Shane Burleigh said.

item.title: ‘I opened her door and the wind caught me, and I went flying’: The U.S. Arctic air surge is sweeping northerners off their feet
item.description: Nationwide, more than 115,000 customers were without power Tuesday morning, around a third of them in Michigan, according to Poweroutage.us.

item.title: Meta claims ‘no continuing Chinese ownership interests in Manus AI’ after reported $2 billion deal to shore up in AI agent race
item.description: Manus, a Singapore-based platform with some Chinese roots, launched its first “general-purpose” AI agent earlier this year.

item.title: U.S. stocks trading lower in final hour as Fed releases meeting minutes — live
U.S. stocks close lower for 3rd straight day as Fed minutes dim rate-cut hopes
With 'Made in America' ETFs, Trump Media tests politics as an investing theme
